author: r.alxz
content: hi all, I am working on wit/0 implementation for ethereumjs-client and i was wondering if there are any tests that would help confirm our witness collection is correct. for example a blockchain of 5-10 blocks with the witnesses of each would be really helpful to ensure our implementation is consistent, or if there is any other suggestions that would be great!

author: jason.carver
content:
Nope, I don't think there are any test cases published. It's worth noting that `wit/0` is not intended to be consensus-sensitive. ie~ it's ideal to report exactly the same hashes, but it's not critical. One straightforward way to test is by executing a block against only the state identified by the hashes in `wit/0`, and see if it completes successfully.
If you want to send me a witness (hashes and bodies) against a recent mainnet block, I'd be happy to check if it matches the py-evm implementation.
